intro: Sisymbrium junceum var. latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf hoary vetch, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, often with a hairy texture. It typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and along riverbanks.
